word: Jesus answered the accusation of the Jews thus, \93If ye had known what this meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.\94 He had already declared to them that He had kept His Father\92s commandments. When He was accused of Sabbathbreaking in the matter of healing the withered hand, He turned upon His accusers with the question \93Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?\94 In summing up His answer to the questioning of the Pharisees He said, \93Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.\94 Here Christ justified His work as in perfect harmony with the Sabbath law.\97Signs of the Times, Feb. 28, 1878.
